page.title: 15Annan Cemetery
page.content: Annan Cemetery lies aboout 1.5 km. north-west of the town on the road to Brydekirk. The cemetery lies on the high ground to the west of the river. The cemetery was opened in 1866. It is divided into four sections. The 'Old Cemetery' contains graves from 1866 until 1940. Most of the headstones are made from sandstone. The 'New' part is from 1940 onwards. Here the material used is mostly black marble. There is a part allocated for the graves of young Air Force pilots from Canada, New Zealand, Australia & the West Indies, who died during the Second World War. The oldest person we could find died when she was 101 years old. Three young pupils from our school who were drowned in the river in 1979 are buried here. The total perimeter is 1016 metres. Each plot is 3 metres square and can hold six coffins.
